text: Scythris ochrantha is a moth of the family Scythrididae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1909. It is found in South Africa (KwaZulu-Natal, Mpumalanga, Gauteng) and Zimbabwe.Afro Moths The wingspan is about 17 mm. The forewings are yellow-ochreous and the hindwings are blackish-grey.Meyrick E. 1921b. Description of Scythris homoxantha in Descriptions of South African Micro-Lepidoptera. - Annals of the Transvaal Museum 8(2):49–148: p. 116 ==References== ochrantha Category:Moths described in 1909
title: Scythris ochrantha
